sen.j: 吉兆（きっちょう）とは大阪市に本拠がある日本料理の高級料亭である。
sen.e: Kitcho is a high-class Japanese-style restaurant of Japanese cuisine based in Osaka City.
Kitcho, based in Osaka City is a high-class Japanese-style restaurant serving Japanese cuisine.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Kitcho is a high-class Japanese-style restaurant serving Japanese cuisine based in Osaka City.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: なお、「吉兆」の屋号で店舗を運営する4社と関連法人を纏めて吉兆グループと称する。
sen.e: 4 companies operating restaurants under yago (the name of the store) of "Kitcho" and affiliated companies are collectively called Kitcho Group.
4 companies operating restaurants under yago (the name of the store) of "Kitcho" and affiliated companies are collectively called Kitcho Group.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Four companies operating restaurants under the yago (the name of the store) of 'Kitcho' and affiliated companies are collectively called the Kitcho Group.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 創業者・湯木貞一は神戸の料理屋「中現長」の息子であったが家を出て、1930年11月21日、大阪市西区 (大阪市)新町にて「御鯛茶處吉兆」を開業した。
sen.e: Teiichi YUKI, founder, who was born a son of restaurant, "Nakagencho," in Kobe left home, and opened "Ontai Chadokoro Kitcho" in Shinmachi, Nishi Ward (Osaka City), Osaka City on November 21, 1930.

Teiichi YUKI, founder, who was the son of the owner of the Kobe restaurant, "Nakagencho." He left home, and opened "Ontai Chadokoro Kitcho" in Shinmachi, Nishi Ward (Osaka City), Osaka City on November 21, 1930.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: The founder Teiichi YUKI, who was the son of the owner of the Kobe restaurant, 'Nakagencho,' left home, and opened 'Ontai Chadokoro (a Tai-chazuke (rice topped on sliced sea bream mixed with green tea) restaurant) Kitcho' in Shinmachi, Nishi-ku Ward, Osaka City on November 21, 1930.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 「吉兆」とは、西宮戎神社や今宮戎神社などで毎年1月10日を挟んで前後3日間に行われる十日戎（とおかえびす）に授与される福笹につける子宝のことである。
sen.e: "Kitcho" means Kodakara (lucky ornaments) attached to Fuku-zasa (treasure shaped bringers of good luck stuck on a sprig of bamboo grass) granted at Tooka-Ebisu (a festival held on January 10 in honor of Ebisu, the god of wealth) for three days before and after January 10 every year at Nishinomiya Ebisu-jinja Shrine and Imamiya Ebisu-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処子宝→Kodakara (lucky ornaments)[http://kyoto-brand.com/columns/090113.html の記述を参照し、左記の通り英訳しました。]（用語サイトには未登録です。ご検討お願い致します。）
sen.e: "Kitcho" means Kodakara (lucky ornaments) attached to Fuku-zasa (treasure shaped bringers of good luck stuck on a sprig of bamboo grass) granted at Tooka-Ebisu (a festival held on January 10 in honor of Ebisu, the god of wealth) for three days before and after January 10 every year at Nishinomiya Ebisu-jinja Shrine and Imamiya Ebisu-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kitcho means Kodakara (lucky ornaments) attached to Fuku-zasa (treasure shaped bringers of good luck stuck on a sprig of bamboo grass) granted at Toka-Ebisu (a festival held on January 10 in honor of Ebisu, the god of wealth) for three days before and after January 10 every year at the Nishinomiya Ebisu-jinja Shrine and the Imamiya Ebisu-jinja Shrine, and so on.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また福笹自体も吉兆笹と呼ばれており、店名はそれに由来する。
sen.e: Fuku-zasa itself is also called Kitcho-zasa, and the restaurant was named after this Kitcho-zasa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Fuku-zasa itself is also called Kitcho-zasa, and the restaurant was named after this Kitcho-zasa.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Fuku-zasa itself is also called Kitcho-zasa, and the restaurant was named after that term.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 湯木貞一と縁故のあった画家須磨対水により縁起を担いで付けられた。
sen.e: The restaurant was named by a painter, Taisui SUMA, who had a relationship with Teiichi YUKI, for good luck.
The restaurant was named by a painter, Taisui SUMA, who had a relationship with Teiichi YUKI, for good luck.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The restaurant was named by a painter, Taisui SUMA, who had a connection with Teiichi YUKI, for good luck.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 当初は「きっきょう」というルビがふられていたが、お客が「きっちょう」と読んだために「きっちょう」となった。
sen.e: At first, kana, "Kikkyo," was given alongside kanji characters; however, since guests pronounced as "Kitcho," the name was changed to "Kitcho."
At first, kana, "Kikkyo," was given alongside kanji characters; however, since guests pronounced the name as "Kitcho," the name was changed to "Kitcho."
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: At first, kana, 'Kikkyo,' was given alongside the Chinese characters; however, since guests pronounced the name as 'Kitcho,' the name was changed to 'Kitcho.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 間口一間二分五厘、奥行き六間の狭いごく小さな店舗ながら、料理の良さはもちろん、店のしつらえも食器の類も洒落た小料理店であった。
sen.e: It served delicious dishes and prepared sophisticated furnishings, and plates and utensils, for a very small Japanese-style restaurant a little more than 1.83 meters wide by approx. 10.9 meters deep.
sen.cmt: 一間二分五厘→a little more than 1.83 meters[計算によると約1.83921 メートルなので]
sen.e: For being a small Japanese-style restaurant a little more than 1.83 meters wide and approx. 10.9 meters deep, they served delicious dishes and had sophisticated furnishings, plates and utensils.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: For being a small Japanese-style restaurant with a little more than 1.83 meters wide by approximately 10.9 meters long, they served delicious dishes and had sophisticated furnishings, and plates and utensils.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 開店日には一人も客が入らなかったという逸話もあり、そこから現在の吉兆を築いた背景には湯木の才能があったと言われる。
sen.e: There is an episode that the restaurant had no guests on its opening day, but, it is said that present-day Kitcho was accounted for by Yuki's talent.
There was a period when the restaurant had no guests on its opening day, but, it is said that present-day Kitcho is due to Yuki's talent.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: There was an episode that the restaurant had no guests on its opening day, but it is said that present-day Kitcho is due to Yuki's talent.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: やがて船場の旦那衆、上村松園や白井半七、高畑誠一、美術商児嶋嘉助らひいきの客もついて繁盛した。
sen.e: Eventually, the restaurant flourished as it became patronized by wealthy self-employed individuals such as Shoen UEMURA, Hanshichi SHIRAI, Seiichi TAKAHATA, etc., and Kasuke KOJIMA, a fine arts dealer.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Eventually, the restaurant flourished as it became patronized by wealthy self-employed individuals such as Shoen UEMURA, Hanshichi SHIRAI, Seiichi TAKAHATA, etc., and Kasuke KOJIMA, a fine arts dealer.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Eventually, the restaurant was patronized by wealthy self-employed individuals such as Shoen UEMURA, Hanshichi SHIRAI, Seiichi TAKAHATA, and so on, and a fine arts dealer Kasuke KOJIMA, and flourished.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 店が手狭になってきて、1937年11月に旧南区島之内の畳屋町の新店舗（間口三間、奥行き三十間）に移転。
sen.e: Since a larger capacity was required, the restaurant was relocated to a new place (approx. 5.4 meters wide by approx. 54 meters deep) at Tatamiyamachi in former Shimanouchi, Minami Ward in November 1937.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since a larger capacity was required, the restaurant was relocated to a new place (approx. 5.4 meters wide by approx. 54 meters deep) at Tatamiyamachi in former Shimanouchi, Minami Ward in November 1937.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Since a larger capacity was required, the restaurant was relocated to a new location (approximately 5.4 meters wide by approximately 54 meters long) at Tatamiyamachi in former Shimanouchi, Minami-ku Ward in November 1937.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1939年12月には株式会社化している。
sen.e: The restaurant was converted to a joint-stock corporation in December 1939.
The restaurant was converted to a joint-stock corporation in December 1939.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The restaurant was converted to a joint-stock corporation in December 1939.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 戦時中も吉兆は大阪府知事河原田稼吉の計らいで特別に営業を続けられた。
sen.e: Even during the war, Kitcho could continue the operation exceptionally through the good offices of Kakichi KAWARADA, governor of Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even during the war, as an exception, Kitcho was able to continue its operation through the offices of Kakichi KAWARADA, governor of Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Even during the war, as an exception, Kitcho was able to continue its operation through the offices of governor of Osaka Prefecture Kakichi KAWARADA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、大阪大空襲で畳屋町の店舗が道具類もろとも全焼してしまう。
sen.e: However, the restaurant at Tatamiyamachi was burnt down with utensils by the Osaka Air Rapid.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the restaurant at Tatamiyamachi, together with all its utensils, was burnt down during the Osaka Air Raids.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: However, the restaurant at Tatamiyamachi was burnt down during the Osaka Air Raids together with all its utensils.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 被災後は芦屋の自宅で「芦屋吉兆」を開店。
sen.e: After being affected, he opened "Ashiya Kitcho" at his own house in Ashiya.
Following this he opened "Ashiya Kitcho" in his own house in Ashiya.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: After the disaster, he opened 'Ashiya Kitcho' in his own house in Ashiya.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変え、表現を変えました。

tit.j: 多店舗展開・グループ化
tit.e: Opening of many restaurants, and grouping
Opening restaurants, and forming the Group
Opening restaurants, and forming the Group

sen.j: 戦後の1946年2月3日に大阪平野町店を開店。
sen.e: On February 3, 1946 after the war, he opened Osaka Hiranocho store.
On February 3, 1946 after the war, he opened the Osaka Hiranocho store.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: After the war, on February 3, 1946, he opened the Osaka Hiranocho shop.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1948年2月、京都嵯峨店を開店（児嶋嘉助の元別邸）。
sen.e: In February 1948, he opened Kyoto Saga store (using former residence of Kasuke KOJIMA).
In February 1948, he opened the Kyoto Saga store (using the former residence of Kasuke KOJIMA).
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In February 1948, he opened the Kyoto Saga shop in the former villa of Kasuke KOJIMA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 翌1949年4月に児島嘉助の店舗兼本邸を購入して現在の高麗橋店（大阪市）を開く。
sen.e: In April 1949, he bought a store of Kasuke KOJIMA which was concurrently used as residence, and opened present-day Koraibashi store (Osaka City).
In April 1949, he bought a store from Kasuke KOJIMA which was concurrently being used as a residence, and opened present-day Koraibashi store (Osaka City).
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In April of the following year, 1949, he bought a shop that was concurrently being used as a main residence from Kasuke KOJIMA and opened the present-day Koraibashi shop (Osaka City).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 関西の茶人・財界人の引き立てを受けて名声を高め、来阪する内外の要人をもてなすのに欠かせない高級料亭となる。
sen.e: The restaurant rose in fame by receiving patronage from chajin (master of the tea ceremony) and businessmen in Kansai, and established itself as a high-class Japanese style essential to entertain very important persons in and outside Japan who visited Osaka.

The restaurant's fame rose, as chajin (master of tea ceremony) and businessmen in Kansai patronized the place, and it established itself as a high-class Japanese style restaurant essential to entertaining very important persons in and outside of Japan who visited Osaka.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: The restaurant's fame rose, as chajin (master of tea ceremony) and businessmen in Kansai patronized the restaurant, it established itself as a high-class Japanese style restaurant essential to entertaining very important persons in and outside of Japan who visited Osaka.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 貞一には茶懐石に関する著述が多いが、1969年には『暮しの手帖』に花森安治のインタビューによる「吉兆つれづればなし」の連載が始まった。
sen.e: Teiichi wrote many books about Chakaiseki (dishes having before tea ceremony), and began the serialization of "Various stories about Kitcho" in "Kurashi no Techo magazine" in the form of being interviewed by Yasuji HANAMORI in 1969.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Teiichi wrote many books about Chakaiseki (dishes to have before tea ceremony), and began a serialization concerning the "Various stories about Kitcho" in "Kurashi no Techo magazine" in the form of being interviewed by Yasuji HANAMORI in 1969.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Teiichi wrote many books about Chakaiseki (dishes served before the tea ceremony), and began a serialization concerning the 'Kitcho Tsurezurebanashi' in a magazine "Kurashi no Techo" (Notes on Daily Life) in the form of interviews with Yasuji HANAMORI in 1969.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これが、吉兆の名前が一般にも浸透する契機となる。
sen.e: This serialization made the name of Kitcho penetrate into the public.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The serialization penetrated the public, and with it Kicho's name as well.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: The serialization prevailed in the public, and with it Kitcho's name as well.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1979年・1986年・1993年の第5回先進国首脳会議で他の有名料亭をさしおいて日本料理担当に選ばれたことで、世界的に知られる存在となった。
sen.e: In Tokyo Summit in 1979, and other summit conferences held in Japan in 1986 and 1993, Kitcho was assigned to be in charge of Japanese cuisine over other famous Japanese-style restaurants, and came to be known internationally.

In the Tokyo Summit in 1979, and other summit conferences held in Japan in 1986 and 1993, Kitcho was assigned to be in charge of Japanese cuisine over other famous Japanese-style restaurants, and came to be known internationally.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In the 5th summit in 1979, and other summit conferences held in Japan in 1986 and 1993, Kitcho was assigned to preside over other Japanese cuisine fixed at famous Japanese-style restaurants, and came to be known internationally.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1988年には創業者の茶道具コレクションをおさめた「湯木美術館」を設立。
sen.e: In 1988, "Yuki Museum Art" storing founder's collection of tea utensils was established.
In 1988, the "Yuki Museum Art," for storing the founder's collection of tea utensils was established.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In 1988, the 'Yuki Museum of Art' was established for storing the founder's collection of tea utensils.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変え、湯木美術館の訳をホームページに合わせました。

sen.j: 京都、大阪、東京、神戸などで多店舗展開をすすめた。
sen.e: Teiichi opened many restaurants in Kyoto, Osaka, Tokyo and Kobe.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Teiichi opened many restaurants in Kyoto, Osaka, Tokyo and Kobe.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Many restaurants were opened in other cities including Kyoto, Osaka, Tokyo and Kobe.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1991年、創業者の貞一の息子や料理人である娘婿たちを暖簾分けの形で独立させて、吉兆グループとしてグループ会社制に移行。
sen.e: In 1991, Teiichi, founder, gave his sons and his daughters' husbands, cook of Kitcho, independence in the form of goodwill, and established group businesses as Kitcho Group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1991, Teiichi, founder, allowed his sons and his daughters' husbands, as well as cooks of Kitcho, to become independent and established group businesses as Kitcho Group.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In 1991, the founder Teiichi gave his son and his daughters' husbands, who were cooks of Kitcho, the shops respectively, allowing them to form independent shops under the Kitcho name, and established the group businesses as Kitcho Group.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 長男湯木敏夫が本吉兆、長女の婿湯木昭二朗が東京吉兆、次女の婿徳岡孝二が京都吉兆、三女の婿湯木正徳が船場吉兆、四女の婿湯木喜和が神戸吉兆を継承した。
sen.e: His first son, Toshio YUKI, succeeded to Honkitcho, his first daughter's husband, Shojiro YUKI, succeeded to Tokyo Kitcho, his second daughter's husband, Koji TOKUOKA, succeeded to Kyoto Kitcho, his third daughter's husband, Masanori YUKI, succeeded to Senba Kitcho, and his fourth daughter's husband, Yoshikazu YUKI, succeeded to Kobe Kitcho.

His first son, Toshio YUKI, succeeded Honkitcho, his first daughter's husband, Shojiro YUKI, succeeded Tokyo Kitcho, his second daughter's husband, Koji TOKUOKA, succeeded Kyoto Kitcho, his third daughter's husband, Masanori YUKI, succeeded Senba Kitcho, and his fourth daughter's husband, Yoshikazu YUKI, succeeded Kobe Kitcho.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: His eldest son Toshio YUKI succeeded Honkitcho, his eldest daughter's husband Shojiro YUKI succeeded Tokyo Kitcho, his second daughter's husband Koji TOKUOKA succeeded Kyoto Kitcho, his third daughter's husband Masanori YUKI succeeded Senba Kitcho, and his fourth daughter's husband Yoshikazu YUKI succeeded Kobe Kitcho.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1997年 創業者の湯木貞一逝去。
sen.e: In 1997, Teiichi YUKI, founder, passed away.
In 1997, Teiichi YUKI, founder, passed away.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: In 1997, the founder Teiichi YUKI was died.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 日本料理には宮廷料理の系統である有職料理、大名の宴会料理である本膳料理、江戸時代に町人の宴会料理として確立した会席料理などがある。
sen.e: Japanese cuisine is categorized into Yusoku ryori (dishes prepared for the royal court) derived from court dishes, honzen ryori (full-course haute cuisine) which is party dishes for Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), Kaiseki ryori (formally arranged dinner to enjoy sake) established as party dishes for townspeople in the Edo period, etc.

Japanese cuisine is categorized into Yusoku ryori (dishes prepared for the royal court) derived from court dishes, honzen ryori (full-course haute cuisine) which is party dishes for Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), Kaiseki ryori (formally arranged dinner to enjoy sake) established as party dishes for townspeople in the Edo period, etc.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Japanese cuisine is categorized into Yusoku ryori (dishes prepared for the royal court) derived from court dishes, honzen ryori (full-course haute cuisine) which are party dishes for feudal lords, Kaiseki ryori (formally arranged dinner to enjoy sake) established as party dishes for townspeople in the Edo period, and so on.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 吉兆の料理は、献立や、建具や調度品などを一期一会その場の雰囲気や季節に応じて変える「室礼（しつらい）」に至るまで、懐石料理の影響を強く受けている。
sen.e: Both dishes served and "shitsurai" (putting decorations suitable for a season or virtual onto an appropriate indoor places) conducted at Kitcho are strongly affected by Kaiseki ryori (simplified version of the honzen ryori; dishes different from above Kaiseki ryori although the pronunciation is the same), and menus, fittings and furnishing goods are changed in accordance with an atmosphere and season under the concept of Ichigo Ichie (Treasure every encounter).

Both dishes served and "shitsurai" (putting decorations suitable for a season or virtual onto an appropriate indoor places) conducted at Kitcho are strongly affected by Kaiseki ryori (simplified version of the honzen ryori; dishes different from above Kaiseki ryori although the pronunciation is the same), and menus, fittings and furnishing goods are changed in accordance with the atmosphere and seasons under the concept of Ichigo Ichie (Treasure every encounter).
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: The services of Kitcho including the menus and the 'shitsurai', by which fittings and furnishing goods are changed in accordance with the atmosphere and seasons under the concept of Ichigo Ichie (Treasure every encounter), are strongly affected by Kaiseki ryori (a simplified version of honzen ryori; dishes different from the Kaiseki ryori mentioned above, although the pronunciation is the same).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これは創始者の湯木貞一が茶道に造詣が深かったことに理由があり、貞一は後に自らの茶道具コレクションを基に湯木美術館を設立した。
sen.e: This was because Teiichi YUKI, founder, had a detailed knowledge of tea ceremony, and Teiichi established Yuki Museum of Art later based on his collection of tea utensils later.
This was because the founder, Teiichi YUKI, had detailed knowledge of tea ceremony, and Teiichi established the Yuki Museum of Art later based on his collection of tea utensils.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: This was because the founder Teiichi YUKI had a profound knowledge of tea ceremony, and Teiichi established the Yuki Museum of Art later based on his collection of tea utensils.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、高級料亭としては珍しく多店舗展開している。
sen.e: It was rare for a high-class Japanese-restaurant to open so many branch restaurants.
It was rare for a high-class Japanese-restaurant to open so many branch restaurants.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It was rare for a high-class Japanese-restaurant to open so many branches.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 特に東京吉兆の「銀座店」や「ホテル西洋銀座店」、大阪の本吉兆高麗橋店、京都吉兆嵐山店などは、政財界有力者や外国要人の接待で利用されることが多い。
sen.e: In particular, "Ginza store" and "Hotel Seiyo Ginza store" operated by Tokyo Kitcho, Koraibashi store operated by Honkitcho in Osaka, and Ayashiyama store operated by Kyoto Kitcho are often used to entertain influential people in the political and business worlds, and very important persons overseas.

In particular, "Ginza store" and "Hotel Seiyo Ginza store" operated by Tokyo Kitcho, Koraibashi store operated by Honkitcho in Osaka, and Ayashiyama store operated by Kyoto Kitcho are often used to entertain influential people in the political and business worlds, and very important persons overseas.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In particular, the 'Ginza shop' and 'Hotel Seiyo Ginza shop' operated by Tokyo Kitcho, Koraibashi shop operated by Honkitcho in Osaka, and Arashiyama shop operated by Kyoto Kitcho are often used to entertain influential people in politics and business, as well as foreign VIPs.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 東京吉兆「ホテル西洋銀座店」は小泉純一郎が首相在任中に度々利用したことでも知られている。
sen.e: It is famous that Junichiro KOIZUMI often used "Hotel Seiyo Ginza store" while he was a prime minister.
It is well known that Junichiro KOIZUMI often used "Hotel Seiyo Ginza store" while he was prime minister.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: It is well known that Junichiro KOIZUMI often visited 'Hotel Seiyo Ginza shop' while he was the prime minister.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 「吉兆」グループの一角であった船場吉兆では2007年、消費期限・賞味期限偽装に端を発する一連の不祥事が発覚した。
sen.e: In Senba Kitcho, part of "Kitcho" group, a series of scandals inspired by mislabeling of expiry period and best before date was found in 2007.
In Senba Kitcho, part of the "Kitcho" group, a series of scandals caused through mislabled expiration dates and best before dates occured in 2007.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In Senba Kitcho, part of the 'Kitcho' group, a series of scandals caused by mislabeled expiration dates and best before dates occurred in 2007.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 翌2008年5月には、客が食べ残した料理を別の客に使い回していたことが判明、報道により知れ渡った。
sen.e: In May 2008, the fact that Senba Kitcho served leftovers of guests to other guests became clear, and came to people's hearing through reporting.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In May 2008, the fact that Senba Kitcho served the leftovers of guests to other guests became clear, and was reported to the general public.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In May of the following year, 2008, the fact that Senba Kitcho served the leftover food from previous guests to other guests was revealed and reported to the general public.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: このことが追い討ちとなり、船場吉兆は廃業に追い込まれた。
sen.e: Senba Kitcho pursued and attacked by this incident was pushed into closure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Senba Kitcho was pursued over this incident, eventually forcing it to close shop..
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Senba Kitcho was pursued over this incident, eventually forcing it to go out of business.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この事件は、「吉兆」全体のブランドイメージを損ね、本吉兆では前年度に比べ客が半減するなど、グループ他社にも深刻な影響を与えた。
sen.e: This incident damaged a brand image of whole "Kitcho," and had such a serious impact on other companies in the group as the number of guests visiting Honkitcho was halved compared to the previous year.

The incident as a whole damaged the image of "Kitcho," and had such a serious impact on other companies in the group that the the number of guests visiting Honkitcho dropped by half compared to the previous year.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: The incident as a whole damaged the image of 'Kitcho,' and had such a serious impact on the other companies in the group that the number of guests visiting Honkitcho dropped by half compared to the previous year.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1991年創業者の貞一が息子や娘婿たちを暖簾分けの形で独立させた。
sen.e: In 1991, Teiichi gave his sons and his daughters' husbands independence in the form of goodwill.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1991, Teiichi as a sign of goodwill, allowed his sons and his daughters' husbands to become independent.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In 1991, Teiichi, the founder, started his sons and daughters' husbands in the same business.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これにより、長男が本吉兆、長女の婿が東京吉兆、次女の婿が京都吉兆、三女の婿が船場吉兆、四女の婿が神戸吉兆を継承。
sen.e: As a result of this, the first son succeeded to Honkitcho, first daughter's husband succeeded to Tokyo Kitcho, second daughter's husband succeeded to Kyoto Kitcho, third daughter's husband succeeded to Senba Kitcho, and fourth daughter's husband succeeded to Kobe Kitcho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result of this, his first son succeeded Honkitcho, first daughter's husband succeeded Tokyo Kitcho, second daughter's husband succeeded Kyoto Kitcho, third daughter's husband succeeded Senba Kitcho, and fourth daughter's husband succeeded Kobe Kitcho.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: As a result of this, his eldest son succeeded Honkitcho, eldest daughter's husband succeeded Tokyo Kitcho, second daughter's husband succeeded Kyoto Kitcho, third daughter's husband succeeded Senba Kitcho, and fourth daughter's husband succeeded Kobe Kitcho.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 持ち株会社1社、料亭会社5社、不動産管理会社5社の計11社と1つの財団法人湯木美術館で吉兆グループを構成した。
sen.e: Kitcho Group consisted of eleven companies including one holding company, five companies operating Japanese-style restaurants and five property management companies, and one incorporated foundation, the Yuki Museum of Art.

Kitcho Group consisted of eleven companies including one holding company, five companies operating Japanese-style restaurants and five property management companies, and one incorporated foundation, the Yuki Museum of Art.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kitcho Group consisted of eleven companies including one holding company, five companies operating Japanese-style restaurants, five property management companies, and one incorporated foundation, the Yuki Museum of Art.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 料亭5社のうち、船場吉兆は不祥事が立て続けに発覚しグループ他社から支援を得られず、2008年5月に廃業。
sen.e: Among five companies operating Japanese-style restaurants, Senba Kitcho discontinued its business in May 2008 because scandals were found in quick succession, and it could not receive support from other companies in the group.

Among the five companies operating Japanese-style restaurants, Senba Kitcho discontinued its business in May 2008 due to the successive scandals, and was unable to receive support from other companies in the group.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Among the five companies operating Japanese-style restaurants, Senba Kitcho discontinued its business in May 2008 due to the successive scandals, and was unable to receive support from other companies in the group.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 株式会社吉兆は、かつては料亭の営業を行っていた会社だが、現在は吉兆ブランドの管理と各料亭の本店等の不動産を管理する子会社5社に全額出資する持株会社となっている。
sen.e: Kitcho Co., Ltd. used to be a company operating Japanese-style restaurants, but now is a holding company which wholly owns five subsidiaries managing the Kitcho brand and properties such as main store, etc. of each restaurant.

Kitcho Co., Ltd. used to be a company operating Japanese-style restaurants, but is now a holding company which wholly owns five subsidiaries managing the Kitcho brand and properties such as the main store, etc. of each restaurant.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Kitcho Co., Ltd. used to be a company operating Japanese-style restaurants, but is now a wholly owned holding company which holds all shares in five subsidiaries managing the Kitcho brand and properties such as the main shop, and so on, of each restaurant.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 料亭営業会社は、現在株式会社本吉兆、株式会社神戸吉兆（本社の所在は大阪市）、株式会社京都吉兆、株式会社東京吉兆の4社からなり、各会社が株式会社吉兆から吉兆ブランドを、不動産管理会社5社から店舗を借り受けて料亭の営業を行っている。
sen.e: At present, there are four companies operating Japanese-style restaurants such as Honkitcho Co., Ltd., Kobe Kitcho Co., Ltd. (based at Osaka City), Kyoto Kitcho Co., Ltd. and Tokyo Kitcho Co., Ltd., and they operate Japanese-style restaurants by leasing the Kitcho brand from Kitcho Co., Ltd., and leasing stores from five property management companies.

At present, there are four companies operating Japanese-style restaurants such as Honkitcho Co., Ltd., Kobe Kitcho Co., Ltd. (based at Osaka City), Kyoto Kitcho Co., Ltd. and Tokyo Kitcho Co., Ltd., and they operate Japanese-style restaurants by leasing the Kitcho brand from Kitcho Co., Ltd., and leasing stores from five property management companies.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: At present, there are four companies operating Japanese-style restaurants such as Honkitcho Co., Ltd., Kobe Kitcho Co., Ltd. (the main office is based in Osaka City), Kyoto Kitcho Co., Ltd. and Tokyo Kitcho Co., Ltd., and they operate Japanese-style restaurants by leasing the Kitcho brand from Kitcho Co., Ltd., and leasing shops from five property management companies.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 料亭営業会社4社は吉兆グループを構成している。
sen.e: Four companies operating Japanese-style restaurants constitute Kitcho Group.
Four companies operating Japanese-style restaurants constitute Kitcho Group.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The four companies operating Japanese-style restaurants constitute Kitcho Group.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、吉兆グループ各社で定期的な会合を持っているが、営業会社はそれぞれ独自に経営を行っていると発表している。
sen.e: Each company in Kitcho Group has a regular meeting, but announced that each operating company conducted a management independently.
Each company in Kitcho Group has a regular meeting, but announced that each operating company was managed independently.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Each company in Kitcho Group has a regular meeting, but announced that each operating company was managing independently.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、料亭営業会社の一つであった株式会社船場吉兆による一連の不祥事を受けて、吉兆グループ各社は食材や製品の取り扱いが適正に行われているかを監査するコンプライアンス委員会を新設することを決めた。
sen.e: However, in response to a series of scandals by Senba Kitcho Co., Ltd. which was one of the companies operating Japanese-style restaurants, each company in Kitcho Group decided to newly establish a compliance committee auditing whether foodstuffs and products are treated properly.

However, in response to a series of scandals by Senba Kitcho Co., Ltd. which was one of the companies operating Japanese-style restaurants, each Kitcho Group company decided to establish a compliance committee auditing whether foodstuffs and products were being treated properly.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: However, in response to a series of scandals by Senba Kitcho Co., Ltd. which was one of the companies operating Japanese-style restaurants, each Kitcho Group company decided to establish a compliance committee auditing whether foodstuffs and products are being treated properly.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1930年 湯木貞一が大阪市西区 (大阪市)新町にて「御鯛茶處吉兆」を創業。
sen.e: 1930 Teiichi YUKI started "Ontai Chadokoro Kitcho" in Shinmachi, Nishi Ward (Osaka City) Osaka City.
1930 Teiichi YUKI started "Ontai Chadokoro Kitcho" in Shinmachi, Nishi Ward (Osaka City) Osaka City.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1930: Teiichi YUKI started 'Ontai Chadokoro Kitcho' in Shinmachi, Nishi-ku Ward, Osaka City.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1937年 畳屋町に移転。
sen.e: 1937 The restaurant was relocated to Tatamiyamachi.
1937 The restaurant was relocated to Tatamiyamachi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1937: The restaurant was relocated to Tatamiyamachi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1939年 株式会社吉兆を設立。
sen.e: 1939 Kitcho Co., Ltd. was established.
1939 Kitcho Co., Ltd. was established.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1939: Kitcho Co., Ltd. was established.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1945年 畳屋町の店舗が大阪大空襲で焼失。
sen.e: 1945 The restaurant at Tatamiyamachi was burnt down by the Osaka Air Raid.
1945 The restaurant at Tatamiyamachi was burnt down by the Osaka Air Raid.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1945: The restaurant at Tatamiyamachi was burnt down by the Osaka Air Raid.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 被災後は芦屋の自宅で「芦屋吉兆」を開店。
sen.e: ,After being affected, Teiichi opened "Ashiya Kitcho" at his own house in Ashiya.
,After being affected, Teiichi opened "Ashiya Kitcho" at his own house in Ashiya.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After the air raid, Teiichi opened 'Ashiya Kitcho' at his own house in Ashiya.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1946年 大阪平野町に出店。
sen.e: 1946 A new restaurant was opened in Osaka Hiranocho.
1946 A new restaurant was opened in Osaka Hiranocho.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1946: A new restaurant was opened in Osaka Hiranocho.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1948年 京都嵐山にて「嵯峨吉兆」(現、京都吉兆嵐山本店)開店。
sen.e: 1948 "Saga Kitcho" (present-day Kyoto Kitcho Arashiyama main store) was opened in Kyoto Arashiyama.
1948 "Saga Kitcho" (present-day Kyoto Kitcho Arashiyama main store) was opened in Kyoto Arashiyama.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1948: 'Saga Kitcho' (present-day Kyoto Kitcho Arashiyama main shop) was opened in Kyoto Arashiyama.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1949年 高麗橋店開店。
sen.e: 1949 Koraibashi store was opened.
1949 Koraibashi store was opened.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1949: Koraibashi shop was opened.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1956年 船場店開店。
sen.e: 1956 Senba store was opened.
1956 Senba store was opened.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1956: Senba shop was opened.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1961年 銀座店開店。
sen.e: 1961 Ginza store was opened.
1961 Ginza store was opened.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1961: Ginza shop was opened.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1969年 『暮しの手帖』「吉兆つれづればなし」の連載始まる。
sen.e: 1969 The series of "stories about Kitcho" began in "Kurashi no Techo."
1969 The series of "stories about Kitcho" began in "Kurashi no Techo."
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1969: A series of 'stories about Kitcho' started in "Kurashi no Techo."
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1979年 東京サミットで午餐会の料理を提供。
sen.e: 1979 Kitcho served dishes at a luncheon at the Tokyo Summit.
1979 Kitcho served dishes at a luncheon at the Tokyo Summit.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1979: Kitcho served dishes at a luncheon at the Tokyo Summit.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1991年 現在の各事業会社を設立し、グループ会社制に移行。
sen.e: 1991 The group business was formed as a result of establishing each present-day company.
1991 The group business was formed as a result of establishing each present-day company.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1991: The group business was formed as a result of establishing each present-day company.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1997年 創業者の湯木貞一逝去。
sen.e: 1997 Teiichi YUKI, founder, passed away.
1997 Teiichi YUKI, founder, passed away.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 1997: Teiichi YUKI, the founder, passed away.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 2007年 船場吉兆にて、偽装問題が発覚。
sen.e: 2007 Mislabeling issues were found at Senba Kitcho.
2007 Mislabeling issues were found at Senba Kitcho.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 2007: Mislabeling issues were found at Senba Kitcho.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 2008年 船場吉兆が廃業。
sen.e: 2008 Senba Kitcho gave up its business.
2008 Senba Kitcho gave up its business.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: 2008: Senba Kitcho gave up its business.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
